channel.title: Thoughts on my custom gaming PC
channel.description:
Case:CM Storm Scout PSU: ThermalTake 550W [url=http://www.thermaltakeusa.com/products-model.aspx?id=C_00001975]http://www.thermaltakeusa.com/products-model.aspx?id=C_00001975[/url] RAM: 4GB HD:500 GB Seagate CPU: Amd Phenom x6 1090t 6 core processor [url=http://products.amd.com/en-us/DesktopCPUDetail.aspx?id=640]http://products.amd.com/en-us/DesktopCPUDetail.aspx?id=640[/url] Graphics card: Nvidia GTS450 [url=http://www.nvidia.com/object/product-geforce-gts-450-oem-us.html]http://www.nvidia.com/object/product-geforce-gts-450-oem-us.html[/url] Motherboard: Asus am3 [url=http://www.asus.com/Motherboards/M5A97/]http://www.asus.com/Motherboards/M5A97/[/url] CPU Heatsink: BeQuiet!
Links added also buying another 4gb Stick of Ram

item.title: Thoughts on my custom gaming PC
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.source: Thoughts on my custom gaming PC

item.title: Thoughts on my custom gaming PC
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

I would go for the FX-6300 by AMD, instead of the Phenom processor you have in your build. You can overclock the heck out of the FX-6300.

Read full topic
item.source: Thoughts on my custom gaming PC

item.title: Thoughts on my custom gaming PC
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Kidpaparoach:

I<3AMD but the differences are fairly large, care to elaborate?

AMD performs slightly better on multi-threaded tasks assuming the program can fully utilize it, and Intel performs better single threaded. Although the differences are so small its not worth the debate and it has turned into fanboyism.

Read full topic
item.source: Thoughts on my custom gaming PC

item.title: Thoughts on my custom gaming PC
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:8, topic:545241”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=664121.msg4439678#msg4439678 date=1406143314]
Dish that cash out for a GTX 660 or 750. So you can play modern games on at least decent settings.
[/quote]^ Best suggestion so far, you may also want to consider updating your cpu/memory a tad. The memory should be good with 4x2gb of some kind and the cpu cou8ld be a low rank fx and be alright.[/quote]
In all honesty I’d say get a better GPU (r7 265-r9 280 as they are value orientated but have good performance) or sell that PC and build a new one.

[quote=“Ashi, post:10, topic:545241”]You would have been better off with a decent GPU, a CPU by Intel and 8 GB ram.

You’re budget must have been really low. I like the white cables and black case btw[/quote]
Yey :).

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:11, topic:545241”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=664121.msg4439706#msg4439706 date=1406152584]
You would have been better off with a decent GPU, a CPU by Intel and 8 GB ram.

You’re budget must have been really low. I like the white cables and black case btw
[/quote]
We have this cpu debate on every thread it seems. The differences between AMD and Intel are minute now[/quote]
I<3AMD but the differences are fairly large, care to elaborate?

Read full topic
item.source: Thoughts on my custom gaming PC

Elrick:

And IMO Seagate is always a good choice.

Not sure if sarcasm? http://www.pcworld.com/article/2089464/three-year-27-000-drive-study-reveals-the-most-reliable-hard-drive-makers.html

item.title: Thoughts on my custom gaming PC
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

sinisoul:

I want a SSD :C

My second SSD never gets used, the only thing it’s good for atm is making the part of my PC you never see look more bad-ass (http://bit.ly/1nqAoZA). I hope that makes you feel better… :D.

@OP
It’s an… interesting system. I wouldn’t really call it a gaming rig any-more. I like the case in white though.

Read full topic
item.source: Thoughts on my custom gaming PC

item.title: Thoughts on my custom gaming PC
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Where are you going to find a GTS 450? Its 4 years old and almost no one still sells it. Its also not going to perform very well for modern games. You’re better off spending a little bit more on a GTX 750, or a 760 if you can afford it.

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts on my custom gaming PC
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

I would suggest doing 2x4 GB sticks. They’re really not that expensive. And IMO Seagate is always a good choice.

Outside of that, I would suggest posting links to all the pieces.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ilovewebdesign95 wrote:

Case:CM Storm Scout
PSU: ThermalTake 550W http://www.thermaltakeusa.com/products-model.aspx?id=C_00001975
RAM: 4GB
HD:500 GB Seagate
CPU: Amd Phenom x6 1090t 6 core processor http://products.amd.com/en-us/DesktopCPUDetail.aspx?id=640
Graphics card: Nvidia GTS450 http://www.nvidia.com/object/product-geforce-gts-450-oem-us.html
Motherboard: Asus am3 http://www.asus.com/Motherboards/M5A97/
CPU Heatsink: BeQuiet!

Links added also buying another 4gb Stick of Ram
